customblocker.name: Beer Keg
customblocker.description: Amontillado. An entire cask of it. Sweet!

customblocker.name: Beer Keg
customblocker.description: Empty. Perhaps you could saw it in half and sell it to some poor rube as a planter.

customblocker.name: Beer Keg
customblocker.description: Long since tapped out.

customblocker.name: License to Serve Alcohol to Wizards
customblocker.description: You can't run a wizard pub without one of these. Dredmorian zoning laws are extremely strict.

customblocker.name: Wizardly Hatrack
customblocker.description: Does it still count as a wizardly hatrack, if there aren't any wizard's hats on it?

customblocker.name: Faded Wizard Photos
customblocker.description: These appear to be photos of wizards banned from the premises.

customblocker.name: Poster
customblocker.description: It's a poster advertising 'The Biting comedy of Carrot Tip.' Well, it certainly bites.

customblocker.name: Brick Wall
customblocker.description: Actually, it's a cheap cardboard backdrop. But you can't buck tradition.

customblocker.name: Shifty Toilet
customblocker.description: Wow. Someone attempted the rare triple-decker. That takes initiative.

customblocker.name: Skanky Toilet
customblocker.description: You spot a shining ring at the bottom of the bowl, all you have to do is reach in and... On second thought, it's gone man. It's gone.

action.text: Have you ever noticed how Swarmies walk like this, but Thrusties walk like *this*? Nyuk, nyuk, Nyuk...
And *what's* the deal with lutefisk? Amirite? Nyuk, nyuk, Nyuk...
So I said, that's not my blobby, that's my *wife!* Nyuk, nyuk, Nyuk...
Stop me if you've heard this one... A footy, a lucky, and a robo walk into a bar... Nyuk, nyuk, Nyuk...
Hey! Why did the diggle cross the road? 'Cause he didn't feel like tunneling! Nyuk, nyuk, Nyuk...
So *I* say, 'That's why they call it carrot juice, baby!' Nyuk, nyuk, Nyuk...
...and you know the worst part is, I *still* can't find my wallet!' Nyuk, nyuk, Nyuk...
Well, I would have let the goat drive, officer, but he was *drunk*!' Nyuk, nyuk, Nyuk...
So I says to this hero; 'Hold on, I didn't think garbage pickup was until Tuesday!' Nyuk, nyuk, Nyuk...
Hey, you with the eyebrows! Do I come to where you work and knock the plunger out of your hands? Nyuk, nyuk, Nyuk...
So what happened to you, did your face lose an argument with a push broom? Nyuk, nyuk, Nyuk...
But seriously, I've got a higher I.Q. than this guy, and *I'm* a vegetable! Nyuk, nyuk, Nyuk...
So I ask my doctor, 'doc, why does does it hurt when I pee?' And he says, 'What do I look like, a botanist!?' Nyuk, nyuk, Nyuk...
Hey! This ain't no ventriloquist act! No dummys on stage! Nyuk, nyuk, Nyuk...
Hey genius, better check your calendar! Cabaret tryouts ain't until tomorrow! Nyuk, nyuk, Nyuk...
Listen buddy, if I wanted audience participation, I would have asked your mom! Nyuk, nyuk, Nyuk...
Uuurrrgh.... Now that's... what I call.... a tough audience. Nyuk... nyuk... n....

customengraving.name: Note from Management
customengraving.description: The note reads: 'Help! I'm trapped in the vault! Everybody use the emergency clues I left you, and get me out of here!'

action.text: There's a crumpled piece of paper which reads: 'The second number is twice that of the forth. - M'
Someone has doodled all over a piece of paper which reads: 'None of the numbers are odd. - M'
Somebody wrapped their sandwich in a piece of paper which reads: 'The third number is prime. - M'

customblocker.name: License to Serve Alcohol to Wizards
customblocker.description: You can't run a wizard pub without one of these. Dredmorian zoning laws are extremely strict.

customblocker.name: Faded Wizard Photos
customblocker.description: These appear to be photos of wizards banned from the premises.

customblocker.name: Pin-up Calendar
customblocker.description: It's a sexy employees of Brax pin-up calendar. Apparently, his turn-ons include fine food, long walks along the beach, and eviscerating shoplifters.

customblocker.name: Dangerous Toilet
customblocker.description: Some practical joker thought it would be funny to stretch cling film across the seat.

customblocker.name: Mysterious Toilet
customblocker.description: It's possible that this toilet is a cleverly disguised magical portal, ready to whisk you away to the Ministry of Magic. Or far more likely, you're just some freak with his foot crammed down the loo.

customblocker.name: Disgusting Toilet

customblocker.name: Painting of Dredmom
customblocker.description: Dredmor might be a cruel tyrannical despot bent on world domination, but that doesn't mean he didn't love his mama.

action.text: Strange. This room looks like it's been sealed up for years, yet the candles in the corner remain lit.

action.name: Open Coffin
action.description: A mysterious coffin concealed in an secret room. It is now open.

action.text: Oh snap! It's Lord Dredmor's mom. And she's none too happy about having her 300 year beauty sleep interrupted!
The lich's mother vanquished, you notice something shining amongst the ashes.

customblocker.description: A rare subspecies only found in the most depraved dungeons and schoolgirl locker rooms.

customblocker.name: Nat King Kobro (serpens inoblitus)

customblocker.name: Juvenile Drakeling (draconis immaturus)

action.description: Acrid smoke pours from the wreckage of the overloaded machine.

action.text: This room seems to be part of a much earlier dungeon.
The four spirits vanquished, you see a flicker of gold in the center of the maze.
This room is filled with several large rubbery eggs. You can't be certain, but you think you hear a muffled hissing noise coming from somewhere.

customblocker.name: Painting of Kroftblonk
customblocker.description: Kroftblonk of the Twelfth Carbunkle. Crushed to death while attempting to answer the ancient philosophical quandry of whether a wizard could create a rock so big, even he couldn't levitate it.

customblocker.name: Painting of Dungdrake
customblocker.description: Dungdrake the Bereft. Breaker of the fourth wall, and harbringer of clowns.

customblocker.name: Painting of Jaegermalt
customblocker.description: Jaegermalt the Soused. Barred for life from the meadhall of the gods.

customblocker.name: Painting of Vromwart
customblocker.description: Vromwart of the Baleful Hangovers. Please quit blinking so loudly, and turn off the damn lights.

customblocker.name: Painting of Bumthrice
customblocker.description: Bumthrice the Chafed. Trust us, you don't want to know where the rabbit was hidden.

customblocker.name: Painting of Smirnoff
customblocker.description: Smirnoff the Inversed. In glorious People's Republik of Kanadia, spell casts wizard on you!

customblocker.name: Painting of Mincekin
customblocker.description: Mincekin of the Ninth Pillar. Keeper of the mysterious object found in the back of the cutlery drawer that nobody remembers purchasing but is possibly used for straining olives.

customblocker.name: Painting of Bogbeard
customblocker.description: Bogbeard the Imprudent. Tragically found shrunken, gold plated, and turned into a newt after flashed the wrong spell sign in a bad part of wizardtown.

customblocker.name: Painting of Tripewand
customblocker.description: Tripewand the Treacherous. Author of the best-selling necromancer's tome '101 Ways to Murder Your Competition,' praised for it's candid depiction of the dark wizardly arts and unusual choice of basilisk venom as a printing medium.

customblocker.name: Painting of Shampuff
customblocker.description: Shampuff the Scurrilous. Sensational scryer of sinful secret. Saucy scandals a speciality.

customblocker.name: Painting of Lo Mein
customblocker.description: Lo Mein the Detestable. Tall guy. Weird clothing. Keeper of the needle of love.

customblocker.name: Painting of Wydebrym
customblocker.description: Wydebrym the Wanderer. Not all wizards who wander are lost, but they certainly can't be buggered to ask for directions.

customblocker.name: Painting of Hamthrice
customblocker.description: Hamthrice the Upstager. Master of revels. Chewer of scenery.

customblocker.name: Painting of Rando
customblocker.description: The Amazing Rando. Able to assemble flat-pack furniture with his very mind.

customblocker.name: Painting of Poncewane
customblocker.description: Poncewane the Pontificator. A wizard so full of scholarly wisdom he felt compared to share it even when no one was listening.

customblocker.name: Painting of Oatbane
customblocker.description: Oatbane of the Sprawling Immensity. Sage of the open range. Tragically afflicted with diabetus.

customblocker.name: Painting of Rotgob
customblocker.description: Rotgob the Pestiferous. Out to get you, and your little dog too.

customblocker.name: Painting of Dildrik
customblocker.description: Dildrik the Dark. Invented a new form of darkness so soul- wrenchingly devoid of light, it makes your normal everyday blackness seem like a kid's birthday party.

customblocker.name: Painting of Broomstache
customblocker.description: Broomstache the Unpalatable. Reviled for putting brown sauce on his potted unicorn meat.

customblocker.name: Painting of Tubsham
customblocker.description: Tubsham the Contestable. Holder of the venerable left-handed tin opener of justice.

customblocker.name: Painting of Chantsteak
customblocker.description: Chantsteak of the 5th Brunch. Berater of elves.

customblocker.name: Painting of Bargargle
customblocker.description: Bargargle the Recondite. His party piece involving two hard-boiled eggs and a live hamster is now illegal in most of the higher dimensions.

customblocker.name: Mysterious Painting
customblocker.description: Nobody can quite remember this little guy's name, but boy did he get around.

customblocker.name: Mysterious Painting
customblocker.description: A poor lost soul, cursed to walk the land for all eternity, even when standing still.

customblocker.name: Mysterious Painting
customblocker.description: Warning: There's no force in the multiverse more dangerous than a comedic sidekick wizard. Kill on sight.

customblocker.name: Mysterious Painting
customblocker.description: Once a trusted advisor to kings, now fallen on hard times. Last seen holding a cardboard sign saying 'Wizard needs food badly.'

customblocker.name: Painting of Welchtab
customblocker.description: Welchtab the Stingy. Never pay of today, what you can pay off tomorrow... or preferrably, never.

customblocker.name: Painting of Thripwik
customblocker.description: Thripwik the Resolute. Inventor of the world's first submersible lawnmower after accidentally reading the owner's manual upside down.

customblocker.name: Painting of Bogblymp
customblocker.description: Bogblymp the Enlarged. Discoverer of the harmonic frequency of pasta.

customblocker.name: Painting of Pintgin
customblocker.description: Pintgin the Plastered. Twitching left eye of iniquity and the death of parties.

customblocker.name: Painting of Pimshank
customblocker.description: Pimshank the Incredulous. Spent most of his twilight years compiling an intricate 400 page treatise on the non-existence of penguins.

customblocker.name: Painting of Skagstaff
customblocker.description: Skagstaff the Spurious. 26th degree brickmaster and wielder of the clammy handshake of doom.

customblocker.name: Painting of Chinlax
customblocker.description: Chinlax the Tenuous. Chief boffin of bobbins and cogmonger to the royal jiggery-pokery museum.

customblocker.name: Painting of Krustloaf
customblocker.description: Krustloaf the Endurable. Inventor of the late-night mutton and chutney sandwich and custodian of the sacred gravy vaults.

customblocker.name: Painting of Splifwick
customblocker.description: Splifwick of the Inverted Spleen. Master of the three-day sickie and inventor of the self-steering wheelbarrow.

customblocker.name: Painting of Grokdeaf
customblocker.description: Grokdeaf the Off-White. Seeking fellowship for an unexpected journey. Must be pipeweed-friendly.

customblocker.name: Painting of Poldink
customblocker.description: Poldink the Approximate. A very nearly adequate wizard, who came quite close to fame after almost succeeeding to levitate an anvil of Krong over his head.

customblocker.name: Painting of Girthmore
customblocker.description: Girthmore of the Perpetual Stain. Master of gravy and scourge of the all you can eat buffet.

customblocker.name: Painting of Brodank
customblocker.description: Brodank the Ignorant. Inadvertantly invented the first thurmatomic bomb while attemting to dry trainers in a microwave during an ion storm.

customblocker.name: Painting of Fropkin
customblocker.description: Fropkin of the Between-Meals Nosh. Gastronomer royal to the court of King Niblick III.

customblocker.name: Painting of Rumsot
customblocker.description: Rumsot the Hazy. Wounded in the line of duty during the great bourbon riot of '78.

customblocker.name: Painting of Drabflam
customblocker.description: Drabflam the Leisurely. Often criticized for his lackadaisical attitude towards being a slothful shiftless loafer.

customblocker.name: Painting of Shazbrim
customblocker.description: Shazbrim of the Incandescent Capuchon. It's remarkable what can be accomplished with 1500 fireflies and a roll of sellotape.

customblocker.name: Painting of Wagrump
customblocker.description: Wagrump the Decrepit. A wizard so old, he already died twice and didn't even notice.

customblocker.name: Painting of Sotsflap
customblocker.description: Sotsflap the Unquenchable. Attempted to isolate the portion of the human brain associated with chronic alcohol consumption by killing off the surrounding brain cells one at a time.

customblocker.name: Painting of Duckbeard
customblocker.description: Duckbeard the Befowled. Herein lies a cautionary tale of why you should never build your thurmaturgic breeder reactor too close to the local nature sanctuary.

customblocker.name: Painting of Quaffstoat
customblocker.description: Quaffstoat the Infeasible. Learned the hard way that one should never accept double dog dares from Cerberus.

customblocker.name: Painting of Runeflask
customblocker.description: Runeflask of the 4th Sheet. Renowned for his second sight and double-vision.

customblocker.name: Painting of Fapwart
customblocker.description: Fapwart the Provoked. Gifted with the uncanny ability to predict which bar was about to erupt into violent liquor-fueled fisticuffs, simply by walking into it.

customblocker.name: Painting of Kreppo
customblocker.description: Kreppo the Superfluous. Overshadowed by his more talented wizard siblings, Kreppo is the brother nobody remembers.

customblocker.name: Painting of Tribeard
customblocker.description: Tribeard the Tertiary. Wow! If a wizard with one beard is mighty, just imagine how powerful he'd be with three!

customblocker.name: Painting of Kasto
customblocker.description: Militant leader of the Wizard's Republic of Quadrilatera. Rival wizards once tried to assassinate Kasto by hiding a bomb in his wand.

customblocker.name: Painting of Occulus
customblocker.description: Occulus of the Wandering Eyes. You know it's a good painting when the eyes follow you around the room, but do they have to try to look down your shirt?

customblocker.name: Painting of Binro
customblocker.description: Binro the Heretic. A wizard ahead of his time, Binro attempted to prove the night sky was full of tiny microscopic suns by building the world's largest magnifying lens. He was burned alive the very next day after a particularly ill-conceived midafternoon unveiling.

customblocker.name: Painting of Lintdik
customblocker.description: Lintdik the Recalcitrant. Talk to the staff because the wizard isn't listening.

customblocker.name: Painting of Quaatu
customblocker.description: Quaatu of the Fifth Gazebo. Ponderer of the unponderable, and thrower of erasers at first year students.

customblocker.name: Painting of Marlin
customblocker.description: The Amazing Marlin. Unicorn wizard.

action.description: Occulus of the Wandering Eyes. You know it's a good painting when the eyes follow you around the room, but do they have to try to look down your shirt?

customblocker.name: Painting of Dramgristle
customblocker.description: Dramgristle the Vulgar. Keeper of the seven foul curses which must never be uttered in public, lest the speaker be reprimanded with a sharp fine.

customblocker.name: Painting of Faffplank
customblocker.description: Faffplank the Unbecoming. Inadvertently discovered the secret of immortality after eating his own weight in pickled gherkins on a dare.

customblocker.name: Painting of Thryftskint
customblocker.description: Thryftskint the Scrimper. Known to have purse strings so tight, most people mistake his money belt for a tourniquet.

customblocker.name: Painting of Hoggsdreg
customblocker.description: Hoggsdreg the Hospitable. Always keen to teach the younger generation how to properly drain a keg.

customblocker.name: Painting of Vimto
customblocker.description: Vimto the Cordial. Mixologist to the gods. Prefect of the imminent stain.

customblocker.name: Painting of Thrompork
customblocker.description: Thrompork the Sophomoric. Abuser of photocopiers. Inventor of the industrial ham press.

customblocker.name: Painting of Myregin
customblocker.description: Myregin, the Portent of Sorrows. Caveat of Corruption. Prince of Malfeasance. Dweller in the Crepuscule of Ultimate Darkness.

customblocker.name: Painting of Glompint
customblocker.description: Glompint of the Gregarious Tipple. Guardian of the inverted flask of courage.

customblocker.name: Painting of Speckwit
customblocker.description: Speckwit the Bewildered. One-man aether party and connoisseur of the twelve mushroom omelette.

customblocker.name: Painting of Frothlump
customblocker.description: Frothlump the Feckless. Lost his feck in the wizard war of 1809.

customblocker.name: Painting of Gastrum
customblocker.description: Gastrum of the Heavy-Duty Recliner. Twice voted 'most likely to begin eating the undergraduates in the event of a serious snow storm.'

customblocker.name: Painting of Chuntlip
customblocker.description: Chuntlip the Incompetent. Discovered 'the hair of the dog that bit you' doesn't apply to kobro attacks.

customblocker.name: Painting of Mydryff
customblocker.description: Mydryff the Perturbed. Suffered from an acute case of existential dread concerning the half-eaten sausage he left sitting in the refrigerator before going on an 8-month sabbatical.

customblocker.name: Painting of Drossdrip
customblocker.description: Drossdrip the Reckless. He cast magic missile at the darkness.

customblocker.name: Painting of Brothwurst
customblocker.description: Brothwurst the Unhinged. Believed he was being stalked by an elusive rosy pachyderm named 'Mr. Stompy.'

customblocker.name: Painting of Huffbynge
customblocker.description: Huffbynge the Wanting. Overcompensating for a deficiency in the wand department.

customblocker.name: Painting of Diredraught
customblocker.description: Diredraught of the Inebriated Tattoo. Frequently discovered painted blue on top of the local water tower.

customblocker.name: Painting of Grimglut
customblocker.description: Grimglut the Peckish. Inventor of the gravy funnel, bane of the well-stocked sideboard.

customblocker.name: Painting of Wiltbrew
customblocker.description: Wiltbrew the Entertainer. Fatally injured whilst trying to prove he had nothing up his sleeve.

customblocker.name: Painting of Glomflan
customblocker.description: Glomflan the Neighborly. A convivial wizard who believed firmly in the importance of sharing, especially when it came to borrowing a cup of bourbon from the neighbors.

customblocker.name: Painting of Twycebryne
customblocker.description: Twycebryne the Woozy. Has woken up married to a diggle on more than one occasion.

customblocker.name: Painting of Tokesteak
customblocker.description: Tokesteak the Dissolute. Attempted to play dice with the universe, and ended up losing all of reality down a storm drain.

customblocker.name: Long-dead Wizard
customblocker.description: A poignant example of the dangers of over-aged drinking.

customblocker.name: Long-dead Wizard
customblocker.description: A poignant example of the dangers of over-aged drinking.

customblocker.name: Cracked Statue
customblocker.description: Looks like the intoxicated force met the implacable object.

customblocker.name: Wheelbarrow
customblocker.description: The conveyance of choice for intoxicated wizards.

customblocker.name: Wheelbarrow
customblocker.description: The conveyance of choice for intoxicated wizards.

customblocker.name: Wheelbarrow
customblocker.description: The conveyance of choice for intoxicated wizards.

customblocker.name: Wheelbarrow
customblocker.description: The conveyance of choice for intoxicated wizards.

customengraving.name: Wizardly Empties
customengraving.description: There is no word in wizard for 'recycling.'

customengraving.name: Wizardly Empties
customengraving.description: There is no word in wizard for 'recycling.'

customblocker.name: Wall Sconce
customblocker.description: The flames flicker welcomingly at you. Is that incense?

customblocker.name: Dead Adventurer
customblocker.description: The withered husk of a previous adventurer who should have known better than to stand on strange sigils. It looks like he was packing some rather strange experimental hardware.

customblocker.name: Vitriol the Dredmorian
customblocker.description: One of Dredmor's less subtle historical despots. Vitriol sat upon on a throne of blood, in a castle of pain, on a mountain of skulls, next to a river of slime, and downwind from the local hog rendering plant. Unsurprisingly, he received relatively few callers.

customengraving.name: Mysterious Sigil
customengraving.description: There are some strange lines carved into the dungeon floor, nearly invisible under several centuries of dust.

action.text: You hear a voice boom in your head, 'I AM VITRIOL, AND YOU ARE LIKE THE BUZZING OF THAUMITES TO ME!'
'YOU WILL MAKE AN EXCELLENT VESSEL FOR MY RESSURECTION!'
A terrible gurgling noise comes from the massive grate in the middle of the floor.

action.name: Vitriol the Dredmorian
action.description: One of Dredmor's less subtle historical despots. Vitriol's portrait seems to be pulsating with dark energies.

action.text: You hear a voice boom in your head, 'I, VITRIOL, SCOURGE OF DREDMOR, WILL NOT BE DENIED!

action.name: Vitriol the Dredmorian
action.description: One of Dredmor's less subtle historical despots. Vitriol's portrait seems to be positively glowing with powerful necromantic energies, and glowing is never good.

action.text: You hear one final scream of rage and frustration, and then the voice of Vitriol fades away forever.
